text: I ve read a lot about what  counts  as a suicide attempt but I m going to ask it anywaysMost of those questions had to deal with some actual harm people did to themselves  Yesterday I drove to a bridge with the intent to jump but the bridge was closed and I went home  short version  I feel like that doesn t count I have a hard time even believing my first attempt was  real  because even though I tried and tried and tried I could never get it to work properly and I didn t even hurt myself   I know some people may ask  why does it matter  I can t give you any reasons other than it matters to me  I was pegged as a liar growing up  lied about small things like if I finished my food  and I know that everyone hates someone who self diagnoses throws a huge pity party for attention  Normally when I look back on my actions I overthink and make conclusions about what happened that aren t true  or so my friends have told me  For instance  after my  attempt  July   I would look back on it and realize that the method id tried could never have worked  I didn t have the right materials  I didn t leave any marks on my body  and I was able to get up and go to work the next day just fine  No actual possibility of dying  no actual harm   not a real attempt  Same with last night  I just drove around for a really long time and then walked up to the gate  saw that it was closed  and left  I think most people would roll their eyes if I said  I attempted to jump off the bridge  but then find out I didn t even set foot on the bridge itself

text: So fun to write cover letters when you hate yourselfIt just feels supremely dishonest to highlight even the talents that I do have   Like  am I sure I didn t just  dream  having marketable skills and a good work ethic   There s a special cognitive dissonance when you re trying to wring out self praise on the same day you decided it would be too much effort to brush your teeth   It s exhausting to pretend I think I deserve a specific job when I m not  totally  convinced I deserve to live   And from this side of the veil I don t know that I can trust my judgement on what kind of work I would love or hate if when my mental health improves And forget about salary negotiations Sure would be nice to have a robust free healthcare system in the US right about now
summary: It's fun to write cover letters when you hate yourself but it's exhausting to pretend you deserve a specific job when you're not sure if you deserve to live. It would be nice to have a robust free healthcare system in the US right about now.
